title: Class 8 website to access the Honeydew ebook for free

requirements.text: Create a coherent, student-friendly visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and layout) and apply it consistently across all pages and components (avoid a blue/purple primary palette).

quotes: Build a website for class 8th students where students can access ebook for free (the book name which students can access is honeydew

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent theme (typography scale, color tokens, button styles, card styles).
Primary/brand color scheme is not blue+purple.

requirements.text: Implement a simple landing page for Class 8 students that clearly lists the available free ebook: “Honeydew”, with a prominent action to open/read it.

quotes: Build a website for class 8th students where students can access ebook for free (the book name which students can access is honeydew

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page displays the ebook title “Honeydew”.
A clear “Read now” (or equivalent) action navigates to an ebook reading view.
UI is responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Add an ebook reading view for “Honeydew” that allows students to read the book in-browser and optionally download it, without requiring login.

quotes: students can access ebook for free (the book name which students can access is honeydew

acceptanceCriteria: The Honeydew ebook can be opened in an in-browser viewer (e.g., embedded PDF view).
A visible download link/button is available.
No authentication is required to access the reader or download.

requirements.text: Add backend support to serve a minimal catalog of available ebooks (initially only “Honeydew”), including title and a frontend-accessible asset path/URL for the ebook file.

quotes: the book name which students can access is honeydew

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a query method that returns a list containing an entry for “Honeydew”.
Frontend fetches the ebook catalog and renders it on the landing page.
The reader view uses the catalog entry’s asset path/URL to open the Honeydew ebook.

requirements.text: Add the Honeydew ebook file as a static frontend asset and wire it to the ebook catalog entry (use a clearly named PDF file path under frontend/public). If the actual PDF cannot be provided at build time, include a placeholder PDF and a single documented place to swap in the real file without code changes.

quotes: access ebook for free (the book name which students can access is honeydew

acceptanceCriteria: A PDF exists under frontend/public and is accessible via the browser at a stable path.
The app’s “Honeydew” entry points to that stable path.
If a placeholder is used, there is one obvious replacement step (swap the PDF file, keep filename the same) and the app continues to work.

requirements.text: Generate and include basic static brand assets for the site (logo and a simple hero illustration) and render them in the UI as static assets (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing page displays the generated logo and hero illustration.
No backend routes/methods are used to deliver these images.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; only compose/reuse them.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services or databases).
nonGoals: User accounts, logins, or Internet Identity sign-in flows.

required: Simple student-friendly logo mark with the word “Honeydew” (honeydew-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Warm, minimal hero illustration of a student reading with books and a soft, non-blue/purple palette (honeydew-hero.dim_1600x900.png)

goalsToAdd: Provide a free, simple website for Class 8 students to read the Honeydew ebook online.
preferencesToAdd: All user-facing text should be in English.
